Issues.Title: Use case of <base href="/> if i customize this to / test it is not reflecting on url
Issues.Body: May it is a silly question, but when should i customize the <base href /> tag and why?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use case of <base href="/> if i customize this to / test it is not reflecting on url" (#836)

Issues.Title: Separate The .NET Core to WASM Experience from Blazor
Issues.Body:
Please consider separating the UI-specific parts of this project from the basic capability to compile .NET Core code to WASM. There are many scenarios where it would be an advantage to run C# code without needing a full UI framework (or this framework).

Minimally, I would expect the compilation process to produce:

1. The WASM module
2. A JavaScript module with a series of exports corresponding to WASM module function exports
3. A TypeScript d.ts file which describes the WASM  module function exports

The combination of the above allows consumers to call the compiled code in a type-safe way from JavaScript or TypeScript.

This seems like a 1st step that we would want to get right, before proceeding on to building a full UI framework. It's an important step in democratizing the .NET ecosystem so that anyone can build frameworks, not just Microsoft.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Separate The .NET Core to WASM Experience from Blazor" (#835)

Issues.Title: Blazor App - simple bug, hard to fix - make DOM/window properties and events available in Blazor
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Blazor App - simple bug, hard to fix - make DOM/window properties and events available in Blazor" (#834)

Issues.Title: Unable to host in IIS on Windows 10 as an application
Issues.Body:
I am unable to get Blazor working using the `Blazor (ASP.NET Core hosted)` template while hosting the application as an IIS application on my local Windows 10 machine.

- File, New Project, ASP.NET Core Web Application
- Name: `BlazorDotNetHosted`, click `OK`
- Select `Blazor (ASP.NET Core hosted)`
- Right-click `BlazorDotNetHosted.Server` and select Publish
- Select `Folder`, note it's going to `bin\Release\netcoreapp2.1\publish\`, click Publish
- Create local folder at `D:\apps\web\BlazorDotNetHosted`
- Copy+paste contents at `bin\Release\netcoreapp2.1\publish\` to `D:\apps\web\BlazorDotNetHosted`
- Open IIS, navigate to `Default Web Site`
- Right-click `Default Web Site` and select `Add Application`
- Alias: `BlazorDotNetHosted`, Application Pool: `DefaultAppPool`, Physical path: `D:\apps\web\BlazorDotNetHosted`, click `OK`
- Click `Browse..` to view the app at `http://localhost/BlazorDotNetHosted/` and note that the page just says `Loading...`

Things I've tried:

Update the app base path as suggested [here](https://blazor.net/docs/host-and-deploy/index.html#app-base-path) by opening the `index.html` at `D:\apps\web\BlazorDotNetHosted\BlazorDotNetHosted.Client\dist\index.html` and edit the `base` element to add the path:

```
<base href="/BlazorDotNetHosted/" />
```

This does allow the application to load.  However the links don't work as the `navbar-brand`, `Counter`, and `Fetch Data` links are `localhost`, `localhost/counter`, and `localhost/fetchdata`.  I even tried installing the `URL Rewrite Module` as suggested [here](https://blazor.net/docs/host-and-deploy/index.html#standalone-deployment).

If I manually navigate to `localhost/BlazorDotNetHosted/counter` that page works.

If I manually navigate to `http://localhost/BlazorDotNetHosted/fetchdata` it loads the page but the api call in Chrome Dev tools shows 404 not found on `http://localhost/api/SampleData/WeatherForecasts`.  

If I hit the api at `http://localhost/BlazorDotNetHosted/api/SampleData/WeatherForecasts` that returns data successfully.



I feel like I'm very close but I'm unsure of how to get it to respect the `base` element.  Am I doing something wrong or is this not supported?  Does it have to be deployed to the root of a web server or hosted in app service at the root url?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to host in IIS on Windows 10 as an application" (#833)

Issues.Title: Fix #773 (for real this time)
Issues.Body:
The problem is that the new HTML rewrite pass was traversing into
attributes of all kinds and would turn any HTML content inside those
attributes into elements where possible. The solution is to not do
that.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix #773 (for real this time)" (#832)

Issues.Title: 0.3.0 Blank after Loading
Issues.Body: I've seen someone else with this issue, but it seemed to relate to an upgraded project. I'm trying to run the default generated project for a Blazor Standalone with a new application and as the title says it's blank after Loading... disappears.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "0.3.0 Blank after Loading" (#829)

Issues.Title: Native Electron/Cordova Support
Issues.Body: One thing that I think would be valuable and would help broaden the use cases and appeal of Blazor would be first class integration with Electron and Cordova. This would include things like tooling in Visual Studio, debugging support, etc. A tight integration with these two other platforms would allow a high degree of code-base sharing across Web (backend / frontend), Desktop, and Mobile in a single language and programming paradigm. I think this would be a great boost to productivity.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Native Electron/Cordova Support" (#826)

Issues.Title: Error BL9981: Unexpected closing tag 'div' with no matching start tag
Issues.Body:
Blazor: 0.3.0 IDE: VSCode Steps to Reproduce: 1. Scaffold Blazor "hosted" (although I suspect any type will do). dotnet new blazorhosted 2. Open MainLayout.cshtml 3. Apply an HTML block comment to the inner div tag containing the @Body method. From: ```
@Body
``` To: ``` ``` 4. Bug. ``` C:\...\Shared\MainLayout.cshtml(44,1): error BL9981: Unexpected closing tag 'div' with no matching start tag. [C:\....csproj] 0 Warning(s) 1 Error(s) ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Error BL9981: Unexpected closing tag 'div' with no matching start tag" (#827)

Issues.Title: Template files that are app code should not have license info in them
Issues.Body:
For example:

https://github.com/aspnet/Blazor/blob/dev/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.Templates/content/BlazorHosted-CSharp/BlazorHosted-CSharp.Server/Program.cs#L1-L2

I recommend scanning all the template files and removing the .NET Foundation license from files that end up as application code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Template files that are app code should not have license info in them" (#824)

Issues.Title: Complete the UIEventArgs, UIKeyboardEventArgs, UIMouseEventArgs, UIPointerEventArgs
Issues.Body:
UIEventArgs
- Bubbles
- Cancelable
- Composed

UIKeyboardEventArgs
- Code
- Location
- CtrlKey
- ShiftKey
- AltKey
- MetaKey
- Repeat
- IsComposing

UIMouseEventArgs
- ScreenX
- ScreenY
- ClientX
- ClientY
- CtrlKey
- ShiftKey
- AltKey
- MetaKey
- Button
- Buttons
- RelatedTarget (prepared - need EventTarget support)
- Region

UIPointerEventArgs
- PointerId
- Width
- Height
- Pressure
- TangentialPressure
- TiltX
- TiltY
- Twist
- PointerType
- IsPrimary
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Complete the UIEventArgs, UIKeyboardEventArgs, UIMouseEventArgs, UIPointerEventArgs" (#823)

Issues.Title: Browser Culture & other environment variables
Issues.Body:
It would be very useful to have informationon about the runtime environment, such as browser culture, in an Environment class. In particular the CurrentCulture might be set automatically to the browser culture, so that dates and numbers might be automatically displayed according to the Browser culture.
(I know this is easily achieved by calling some JavaScript environment filling function, but....)

It would be nice to have also information on the supported tags, so that "smart components" might automatically revert to widget when an Html5 input is not supported (Html5 input support is far from being complete on the mainstream browsers...also among the ones that support WebAssembly).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Browser Culture & other environment variables" (#807)

Issues.Title: Blazor - Select drpdown list issue
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Blazor - Select drpdown list issue" (#811)

Issues.Title: One Time Binding
Issues.Body:
Add support for one time binding, such that once the binding has been evaluated and set, it does not take part in future refreshes of the component. 
This will be helpful in gaining some performance where we know that some of the data is not going to change during the life cycle of the component. For example some json content fetched from server which needs to be rendered in a table and we know this data will not change for very long time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "One Time Binding" (#816)

Issues.Title: Build Blazor page/component and publish it to npm/nuget
Issues.Body:
> TL; DR: this is more like feature proposal for future Blazor Cli Taking inspiration from Vue that can [build SFC (Single File Component) `*.vue`](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-cli/blob/dev/docs/cli.md#vue-build) into redistributable [package](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-cli/blob/dev/docs/build-targets.md#library), it would be nice if Blazor can do the same thing. Because Blazor [can be compiled into](http://blog.stevensanderson.com/2018/02/06/blazor-intro/) `*.dll` (AOT compiled mode) and `.wasm` (interpreted mode), it also make sense to have ability to build and publish single Blazor Component (`.cshtml`) into NuGet and/or NPM for shareabilitiy.
Given this Blazor Component (if in the future Blazor support F#) with usage ```html ``` then the implementation of `Propeller.fshtml` will be ```fs @functions { /// https://quadcopterproject.wordpress.com/static-thrust-calculation/ [] type rad (* revolution or radians *) [] type s (* second *) [] type m (* meter *) [] type px (* pixels *) [] type kg (* kilogram *) [] type N = (kg*m)/(s^2) (* Newtons *) [] type W = (N*m)*(rad/s) (* Watts *) (* P = τ * ω *) let π = 3.14159265359 let HertzOf (rpm : ) : float = rpm/60 [] let cm = 1/100 let public scale : float = 1.0 val public power : float val public diameter : float val public propconstant : float let public propRpm powerFactor : float = (power/propconstant)^(1/powerFactor) member Rpm with get () = propRpm(3.2) member Thrust : float with get () = ((π/2) * (diameter^2) * 1.225 * (power^2) )^(1/3) member Period : float ``` ### Build as WebComponent > If Blazor heading toward to support WebComponent The produced WebComponent are just binding to the generated WebAssembly. #### CLI ```bash dotnet blazor build --target wc Propeller.fshtml cd dist npm version minor npm publish ``` #### Usage - via CDN ```html
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build Blazor page/component and publish it to npm/nuget" (#820)

Issues.Title: [Bug] Inserting text from intellisense for @using doesn't work correctly
Issues.Body:
**Software**
VS 15.7.0 Preview 6
Blazor 0.3.0

**Steps**
- Create a new Blazor project (I have selected hosted, but probably it is not important, project name BugReport)
- Open `BugReport.Client\_ViewImports.cshtml` file
- In the new line at the end of the file (line 8) type `@using BugReport.Client.` You will see two options in intellisense. Select any of them.

**Expected behaviour**
Selected text is inserted after dot in the current line.

**Current behaviour**
Text is appended to end of line 6. This is the first line which contains the text `@using BugReport.Client` without dot at the end. You can try to write `@using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.` and you will see that selected text will be appended to the end of line 2 where we have `@using Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] Inserting text from intellisense for @using doesn't work correctly" (#822)

Issues.Title: bind-value-oninput throws
Issues.Body:
Currently when we use `<input bind="@myVariable" />` variable is updated when input field looses focus (onchange event is called). Popular requirement in many applications is to implement incremental search. To do this we need:

- binding which updates variable after every input field change
- throttling - this is necessary if we want to do incremental search on the server or we have a big collection to filter; we should be able to specify a delay in milliseconds and our variable should be updated only after user stops typing for the specified period of time

I believe that throttling can be useful for other events also, for example mouse move, mouse wheel scrolling, etc.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bind-value-oninput throws" (#821)

Issues.Title: Create a VSCode extension for the razor files used by Blazor.
Issues.Body: Most modern web developers use VS Code, which should provide a first class experience for developing Blazor applications, including IntelliSense for the Razor syntax and C# objects.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Create a VSCode extension for the razor files used by Blazor." (#814)

Issues.Title: Dependency Injection for dynamic Dependency Injection
Issues.Body:
I'm new to Blazor so perhaps this is already supported but not documented functionality, but is there a way to inject the ServiceProvider itself so that a component or service can resolve dependencies dynamically?

If this isn't already possible, it'd be great to be able to do so!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dependency Injection for dynamic Dependency Injection" (#819)

Issues.Body:
Hi team,

According to Readme that mentioned about "Server-side rendering" feature. Is it ready to use yet? As I can not see any configuration or tutorial show how to activate the feature.

Thanks.
Huy
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Is Server-side rendering feature able to use on the latest Blazor version yet?" (#817)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Font-Awesome spinner breaks blazor UI rendering with no error" (#818)

Issues.Title: Add support for sending and receiving arbitrary HttpContent, refs #479
Issues.Body:
This adds support for sending arbitrary `HttpContent` by writing it to a `byte[]` first and then zero copy marshalling that as `Uint8Array` which is supported as request body.
It also supports receiving binary data by getting an `ArrayBuffer` from fetch, allocating a managed array of that size and then copying the response over.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add support for sending and receiving arbitrary HttpContent, refs #479 " (#815)

Issues.Title: ability to deserialize arrays through IDictionary<string, object>
Issues.Body:
Added ability for `JsonUtil.Deserialize<IDictionary<string, object>>(json)` to properly deserialize arrays to support a scenario where you want to deserialize json for which you don't know the schema at compile time.

fixes #812
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ability to deserialize arrays through IDictionary<string, object>" (#813)

Issues.Title: Unable to deserialize arrays via IDictionary<string, object>
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to deserialize arrays via IDictionary<string, object>" (#812)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build MSB3073 error when I'm trying to ref some of my current netstandard library" (#808)

Issues.Title: .cshtml does not accept 'string' for a 'object' type parameter
Issues.Body:
I've created a button with

```
[Parameter]
public object Content {get;set;}

<XButton Content="Click Me !" Clicked="@MyHandler" ref="_button"></XButton>
```

Visual studio does not recognize 'Content' value, 

Error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5623089/39875008-98d9ce6e-5499-11e8-8d70-a521ddbf7873.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".cshtml does not accept 'string' for a 'object' type parameter" (#810)

Issues.Title: Support binding to <select multiple>, getting/setting the selection as an array
Issues.Body:
With the following code
```
 <select name="cars" multiple onchange="@SelectionChanged">
        <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>
        <option value="saab">Saab</option>
        <option value="opel">Opel</option>
        <option value="audi">Audi</option>
    </select>
 void SelectionChanged(UIChangeEventArgs e)
        {
            Console.WriteLine(e.Value);
        }
```
Holding down the ctrl key, if you select 'volvo' first and then any other value, e.value is always 'volvo'. It basically returns the top selected item in the list.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support binding to <select multiple>, getting/setting the selection as an array" (#809)
